headline: Quantum Computing Market Research Report 2025-2030: Market Accelerates with Rising Financial-sector Use Cases, Growing Investment Flows, and a Surge in Partnerships and R&D Alliances
summary: The global quantum computing market is set to grow from USD 3.52 billion in 2025 to USD 20.20 billion by 2030, with a CAGR of 41.8%. The demand for high-performance computing in drug discovery, financial modeling, and logistics optimization drives this growth, countered by challenges like high error rates and qubit instability. headline: Wall Street bets big on AI while watching Washington unravel
summary: You can catch Trader Talk on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. Is Washington chaos really what’s moving your money, or is it just noise? On this episode of Trader Talk, Kenny Polcari breaks down how the 2026 midterm elections, government shutdown drama, and policy shocks surrounding tariffs, healthcare, EV credits, and rare earth metals can cause entire sectors to be slammed overnight, while long-term investors stay focused on fundamentals. Then Schwab Network lead market technician Richard Ducat joins to map out where the real action is in AI and quantum computing, from legacy names like IBM to up-and-coming chip and automation plays. They wrap with a look at gold versus bitcoin, what the rush into alternative assets says about market fear, and how traders can keep their portfolios disciplined when headlines go off the rails. Watch more episodes of Trader Talk here. Trader Talk with Kenny Polcari on Yahoo Finance delivers expert analysis and actionable insights, empowering you to navigate market volatility and secure your financial future. This post was written by Langston Sessoms.

Is Washington chaos really what’s moving your money, or is it just noise? Then Schwab Network lead market technician Richard Ducat joins to map out where the real action is in AI and quantum computing, from legacy names like IBM to up-and-coming chip and automation plays. They wrap with a look at gold versus bitcoin, what the rush into alternative assets says about market fear, and how traders can keep their portfolios disciplined when headlines go off the rails.

Watch more episodes of Trader Talk here.

Trader Talk with Kenny Polcari on Yahoo Finance delivers expert analysis and actionable insights, empowering you to navigate market volatility and secure your financial future.

This post was written by Langston Sessoms.

headline: IBM (IBM): Exploring Valuation After Recent Share Price Momentum
summary: International Business Machines (IBM) has drawn fresh attention from investors following its recent stock performance. After gaining 4% over the past month and nearly 19% in the past 3 months, many are watching for signs of continued momentum. See our latest analysis for International Business Machines. This momentum comes after a year marked by impressive results, with International Business Machines delivering a 49% total shareholder return and over 36% share price growth year-to-date...

headline: Analysis-Futuristic quantum computing stocks take speculators on roller-coaster ride
summary: (Reuters) -Investors in pure-play quantum computing stocks are grappling to value these futuristic companies, making prices highly volatile for the latest hot trend on Wall Street.  Rigetti, IonQ, D‑Wave Quantum and Quantum Computing Inc are racing to turn quantum theory into machines that could crack problems beyond the scope of today's computers, possibly assisted by artificial intelligence.  "All of a sudden, it feels like science fiction has moved into the world of real technological possibility," said Sylvia Jablonski, chief investment officer of Defiance ETFs, who oversees the Defiance Quantum fund.

content.title: Analysis-Futuristic quantum computing stocks take speculators on roller-coaster ride
content.summary: (Reuters) -Investors in pure-play quantum computing stocks are grappling to value these futuristic companies, making prices highly volatile for the latest hot trend on Wall Street.  Rigetti, IonQ, D‑Wave Quantum and Quantum Computing Inc are racing to turn quantum theory into machines that could crack problems beyond the scope of today's computers, possibly assisted by artificial intelligence.  "All of a sudden, it feels like science fiction has moved into the world of real technological possibility," said Sylvia Jablonski, chief investment officer of Defiance ETFs, who oversees the Defiance Quantum fund.

headline: IBM and Agassi Sports Entertainment Announce AI-Powered Platform to Advance Global Racquet Sports
summary: Agassi Sports Entertainment (ASE) Corp. (OTC PINK: AASP) and IBM (NYSE: IBM) today announce a multi-year collaboration to transform the global racquet sports landscape through next generation artificial intelligence and digital innovation. They have signed a partnership agreement to bring together IBM's technology and expertise with ASE's vision for an innovative digital community across racquet sports.

content.title: IBM and Agassi Sports Entertainment Announce AI-Powered Platform to Advance Global Racquet Sports
content.summary: Agassi Sports Entertainment (ASE) Corp. (OTC PINK: AASP) and IBM (NYSE: IBM) today announce a multi-year collaboration to transform the global racquet sports landscape through next generation artificial intelligence and digital innovation. They have signed a partnership agreement to bring together IBM's technology and expertise with ASE's vision for an innovative digital community across racquet sports.

headline: Hazeltree: Short Sellers Turn Defensive as Consumer Names Lead Global Crowdedness; Tech Remains a Key Target
summary: NEW YORK & LONDON, November 05, 2025--Global equity markets showed notable divergence in October, shaped by renewed U.S.–China trade tensions, a U.S. government shutdown and diverging central bank policies.
